After exile, a Syrian family feels the call of their homeland
subhead: After living in Lebanon for 10 years, Fodda and Walid El-Youssef returned in October with their five children to the hamlet they had been forced to abandon during the civil war. As farmers with expertise in agroecology, they aim to help rebuild agriculture and sow the seeds for Syria's future.

Chile's presidential race heads to runoff between communist and hard-right candidates
subhead: Jeannette Jara, 51, a communist and former labor minister representing Chile's center-left governing coalition, won 26.85% of votes with 99% counted – insufficient to win in the first round. Hard-right ex-lawmaker and devout Catholic José Antonio Kast, 59, secured more than 23.93%. A second round will take place on December 14.

title: How facial recognition-based age verification became the norm online, despite its flaws
subhead: The effectiveness of this technology, and its biases, has been regularly questioned. But it has become the preferred tool to block minors from accessing certain online services.

title: Photographer documents the Bataclan's slow rebirth after the 2015 Paris attacks
subhead: Vassili Feodoroff has photographed more than 40 concerts at the Bataclan since 2023. Ten years after the November 13 attacks, he has become a privileged witness to the slow but unmistakable resurrection of a venue that has rebuilt itself alongside its audience.

title: London's 'mudlarks' scour the Thames for treasure
subhead: On the banks of the British capital's river, London's 'mudlarks' search for fragments of the past: ancient pottery, old coins, bone dice. These enthusiasts are less motivated by the value of the objects than by the stories they tell. Sometimes, their finds even end up in a museum, as is currently being shown in an exhibition at the London Museum.

How the French left fractured over security and secularism after 2015 Paris attacks
subhead: Then president François Hollande's proposal to enshrine the revocation of citizenship in the Constitution after the attacks deeply divided his own political camp, just as debates over secularism and Islam became flashpoints.

title: 'The Beast in Me' on Netflix: The neighbor with a troubled past
subhead: Claire Danes and Matthew Rhys rescue 'The Beast in Me' from banality, even if the literary thriller miniseries is rather thin.

title: COP30: 'Those drawn to China's environmental push should keep a few facts in mind'
subhead: China is presenting itself as the leader in the renewable energy economy, positioning itself against the United States, which remains entrenched in fossil fuels. Yet, this transition has proven misleading, writes Pascal Riché in his column for Le Monde.
